perturbation.original_text:
13.2
The Manufacturer grants exclusive rights to the Customer for the term of ten (10) years from the date of the signing of this agreement and
for an indefinite period upon the customer fulfilling the minimum annual purchase requirement as listed in Schedule B. of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
13.2
The Manufacturer grants exclusive rights to the Customer for an initial period of five (5) years from the date of the signing of this agreement and this will automatically extend to a ten (10) year period only if the customer exceeds twice the minimum annual purchase requirement as listed in Schedule B. of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: While section 1.2 states that the agreement is for a term of 5 years, this section now changes the duration of the exclusive rights granted, creating a contradiction. If the customer purchase requirement is not double the quantity of Schedule B., the term is still 5 years. But section 1.2 only states 5 years to begin with.

perturbation.original_text:
5.3
Rejection of defective products
The Customer shall inspect all Products promptly upon receipt thereof and may reject any defective Product, provided that the Customer
shall within seven (7) days after receipt of such alleged defective Product, notify the Manufacturer of its rejection and either:
(i)
request to destroy in field for credit of the value of the defective product and the associated shipping costs (with approval), or
(ii)
request a Return Material Authorization (“RMA”) number and within seven (7) days of receipt of the RMA number from the
Manufacturer return such rejected Product to the Manufacturer.
Products not rejected within the foregoing time periods shall be deemed accepted by the Customer.
In the event that the Manufacturer determines that the returned Product is defective and properly rejected by the Customer, the
Manufacturer shall credit to the Customer the value of the defective product and the associated shipping costs.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.3
Rejection of defective products
The Customer shall inspect all Products promptly upon receipt thereof and may reject any defective Product, provided that the Customer
shall within thirty (30) days after receipt of such alleged defective Product, notify the Manufacturer of its rejection and either:
(i)
request to destroy in field for credit of the value of the defective product and the associated shipping costs (with approval), or
(ii)
request a Return Material Authorization (“RMA”) number and within fifteen (15) days of receipt of the RMA number from the
Manufacturer return such rejected Product to the Manufacturer.
Products not rejected within the foregoing time periods shall be deemed accepted by the Customer.
In the event that the Manufacturer determines that the returned Product is defective and properly rejected by the Customer, the
Manufacturer shall credit to the Customer half the value of the defective product and none of the associated shipping costs.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces multiple ambiguities regarding the timeline for rejection of defective products and the value to be credited. The original contract specifies seven days for notification and return, while the modified version extends the notification period to thirty days but keeps 7 days for return and changes the value of defective product. This introduces an uncertainty in enforcement as the time limits and the value for defective products now conflict.
